p: At least twenty-four Combretum species are used in African traditional medicine to treat ailments and diseases such as scorpion and snake bites, mental and heart problems, as well as fever and microbial infections, including diarrhea [ 40]. Combretum species are prepared as hot water decoctions or cold water extracts or mixed with food, such as maize porridge. Some decoctions have proved to be as effective as alcoholic and acetone extracts. Antimicrobially active compounds isolated from Combretum spp. are combretastatins, acidic tetracyclic and pentacyclic triterpenes/triterpenoids, ellagitannins, phenanthrenes, flavonoids, saponins, and cycloartane glycosides [ 26, 40].
